channel.title: moparClassic website login
channel.description: Hey guys right now my loginserver is saving all the players information in a json file. Do i need to change it somehow so it saves all that information in the database instead? And that is how I could integrate it with a website? Can anyone point me in the right direction to get it updating all the player information in the database instead first? Do i need another SQL file other than the Database.sql file included in the main directory

item.title: moparClassic website login
item.dc:creator: @sin sin
item.description:
@sin wrote:

I have it set to MySQL and the database there now, but it doesn’t auto create a user onlogin now.

Does the character need to be created through the website now? And when they login it lets them customize the character?

Can I use the MySQL implementation and also PersistantAuth or do i need to switch that to website auth?

Read full topic

item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

there’s still nothing stopping you from adding whatever extra information you like

item.title: moparClassic website login
item.dc:creator: @sin sin
item.description:
@sin wrote:

stEps:

you can store whatever you choose to in the database. There is a .sql file that comes with moparclassic, this will create the database upon importing it.

I imported the Database.sql file but there doesn’t seem to be a table or database for the player information. There’s alot of PK related tables.

Read full topic

item.title: moparClassic website login
item.dc:creator: @sin sin
item.description:
@sin wrote:

if i store the data in the database, will that also store the users coords, inventory items etc? And if so do I need to create that database manually or is there a SQL file somewhere with the structure I import? Thanks man.

Read full topic

item.title: moparClassic website login
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Go to the login server and look at the config. There are different authentication methods, which are located in org.moparscape.msc.ls.auth.impl. There are also different ways to persist data, which can be found at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.

There are actually two ways you can integrate with a website. Either storing the data in the database, or using the website auth.

The website auth simply makes a GET request to the specified URL and if it returns “YES”, then it is authenticated, anything else is not.
You could also change the persistence class that’s used to MySQL, and just have the website read from that.

Read full topic
